obr
Interface DecidableClassCheck

All Known Implementing Classes:
AtomicHypothesisCheck, DisconnectedCheck, DomainRestrictedCheck, FrontierOneCheck, RangeRestrictedCheck, StickyCheck, WeaklyAcyclicCheck, WeaklyStickyCheck
public interface DecidableClassCheck

Interface for functions checking if a graph of rule dependencies or a subset of this graph belongs to a concrete decidable class.
It provides two methods, the first one is used to check the full set of rules, and the second one to check only a strongly connected component of this set. The classes which implement this interface may be used as a check function in the GRD Analyser.

See Also:
GRDAnalyser

Method Summary
 DecidableClassLabel grdCheck(GraphRuleDependencies grd)
          Checks a graph of rule dependencies.
 DecidableClassLabel sccCheck(GraphRuleDependencies grd, int sccID)
          Checks only a strongly connected component of the graph of rule dependencies.
 

Method Detail

grdCheck

DecidableClassLabel grdCheck(GraphRuleDependencies grd)
Checks a graph of rule dependencies.

Returns:
The associated decidable class label if the grd belongs to this decidable class, null otherwise.

sccCheck

DecidableClassLabel sccCheck(GraphRuleDependencies grd,
                             int sccID)
Checks only a strongly connected component of the graph of rule dependencies.

Parameters:
grd - The graph of rule dependencies.
sccID - The id of the strongly connected component to be checked.
Returns:
The associated decidable class label if the strongly connected component belongs to this decidable class, null otherwise.
